thread.title: NBA | LeBron happy to be in Columbus as part of Cavaliers' preseason | The Columbus Dispatch
thread.title_full: NBA | LeBron happy to be in Columbus as part of Cavaliers' preseason | The Columbus Dispatch

author: The Columbus Dispatch
title: NBA | LeBron happy to be in Columbus as part of Cavaliers' preseason | The Columbus Dispatch
text:
Ohio State men's basketball coach Thad Matta always has treated LeBron James as one of his own – even when it wasn’t popular within the state to do so.
After putting in some extra shooting work before today’s morning shootaround in advance of tonight’s exhibition game against the Memphis Grizzlies in Value City Arena, James said he’s excited for the chance to play on the court he would have called home had he chosen to attend college.
“It’s always great to be here,” he said while sitting courtside. “I’ve spent a lot of time here throughout my life and in high school, so it’s always good to come back.”
This season, Ohio State unveiled a special display outside its men’s locker room featuring all of the exclusive James shoes the team has worn over the years.
“That’s very humbling, especially knowing I never stepped foot on a college campus as a player or as a student,” he said. “To have some links with a couple programs in America, one being here at Ohio State, it means a lot. It lets me know I’m doing something the right way, trying to inspire these kids to be not only great athletes on the floor but great role models off the floor and represent their universities the right way. It’s very humbling, and I thank Ohio State for it.”
James is expected to play against the Grizzlies, who feature a prominent former Buckeye: guard Michael Conley, who led Ohio State to the 2006-07 national championship game in his lone season with the program. Mo Williams, James’ teammate, is out for the game, coach David Blatt said, while J.R. Smith is likely out.
Matta has consistently referenced James and Conley throughout his coaching career, even when James angered Ohioans by leaving the Cavaliers to play for the Miami Heat following the 2010 season. James said he saw Matta this summer at his camp and that he’s impressed with the job he has done with the Buckeyes.
Asked what it meant to have Matta stand by him even when he wasn’t the “most popular guy in the state,” James turned on the humor.
“I’ve been very popular in this state for 30 years,” he deadpanned. “‘All press is good press – John Gotti.’”
A self-professed Ohio State football fan, James was asked what he thought of Urban Meyer’s handling of the quarterback situation this season. The two speak regularly, James said.
“I’m not here (to criticize) Coach,” James said. “He’s done great because he doesn’t listen to guys like me. He’s doing a great job. I think he’s a great leader. I think they’re going to have a great year. I think all Buckeye Nation knows that. It’s great to have support from a guy like that, and I try to give it back to him.”
ajardy@dispatch.com 
@AdamJardy
